bibl.title: Letter from Chauncey B. Baker to Albert E. Truby, January 17, 1935

div1.p: Baker sends Truby a copy of his recollections of yellow fever epidemics in Havana and requests corrections.

div1.head: Letter from Chauncey B. Baker to Albert E. Truby, January 17, 1935
div1.opener:
J.W. SEIDENSTICKER, PRESIDENT
L. SEIDENSTICKER, VICE PRES'T
CHAUNCEY B. BAKER,
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
W.C. GARES, CASHIER
S.W. RODERICK, ASST. CASHIER
MARKET
EXCHANGE
BANK
COLUMBUS, O. January 17, 1935
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
General Truby
c/o Walter Reed Hospital
Washington, D. C.
Dear General Truby:
div1.p:
Sometime ago at a meeting of a Board of
Directors I was asked to give a recital of my experiences in
Havanna with Yellow Fever, which I was very glad to do. They
were so well pleased with the recital that they asked me to put
it in permanent form, which I have done. I am enclosing herewith
a copy for your perusal and for any suggestions, additions or
interlineations that you might deem proper. You will note at
the close that I make special reference to your own interest and
association with Walter Reed Board. When I get this paper back
from you, I will have it rewritten, and of course will furnish
you with one or more copies. It was interesting to me to go over
this matter and especially interesting to me to discuss many of
these details with you while at the Hospital.

I am happy to say that I have continued very
rigidly the routine that you set up for me at the Hospital, and am
having periodical examinations made. They all prove very satisfactory.
I want to thank you and everyone connected with Walter Reed for the
success of my period of hospitalization.
Anticipating a line from you, I am, as always
div1.closer:
Cordially yours Chauncey B. Baker The Board was the head of the American
National Fire Insurance Co.- Members came
from New York, Chicago, Cleveland, Chicago
note also the cities-
C. B. B.
